intro: Andersonia variegata, commonly known as the variegated Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive variegated pattern, adding to its ornamental value. Andersonia variegata is well-suited for cultivation in gardens, especially in coastal or Mediterranean climates.
